questions.question: Best rewrite of 'posterior probabilities favor sideways with a bear transition risk':
options: Signals say the market is mostly flat but could break lower; we’re keeping positions light
questions.explanation: Plain, truthful, risk-aware language helps clients understand decisions.

questions.question: If confidence falls from 72% to 58%, and your policy scales size linearly with confidence above 60% only, what is the new size as % of full if previously at 40% of full? (Assume now below 60% threshold.)
questions.explanation: Below the 60% floor, size reduces to zero per the stated policy.

questions.question: Write one sentence you’d say when trimming a position for risk control.
questions.answer_text: Our model’s confidence decreased, so we trimmed to protect capital while awaiting clearer signals.
